data.title: Alternate stand animations
data.body: This hooks up the unused "stand2" sequences to add a little variation in C&C and RA.

data.title: Display Settings: contrast brightness hue
data.body:
It would be really interesting for some players to be able to modify contrast, brightness and hue.

Some players may have bad (old) monitors and the only way to have a beautiful correct image would be to tweak these settings.

Also, some of the Red Alert and Tiberian Dawn ground tilesets sometimes look a bit dull. Being able to modify the  contrast, brightness or hue could improve their visual quality a lot.

And it would awesome if it would be possible to apply these settings differently for two areas of the game:
- tilesets 
- all the rest (units, buildings, trees...)

I don't know if it's possible but with this option, the player could increase the color of the tileset without affecting the units.. THAT would be really useful, imo.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1042496-display-settings-contrast-brightness-hue?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Cleaned up RA button colors
data.body: as the highlighted one is now used for settings and disabled is usually grey.

data.title: Crash when dog attacks a map object (which cannot be attacked?)
data.body:
Mod: Open RA
Map: KID 3.2 BETA 5 (Created by Kaito Kid)

Build a dog, make it attack "tank trap" and feel the crash! Tank traps are nearby the cliffs around the diamond mines.

data.title: Make use of alternate stand sequences for infantry
data.body: Almost every infantry has a second stand sequence that is currently unused. We should expose these to RenderInfantry, and pick one at random to add a bit of variation.

data.title: Brought back the MoveFlash
data.body: as a counter-part to `TargetFlash`. I know it was removed as it seemed redundant to `SetTargetLine`, but every Westwood game has it even Tiberian Sun which introduced the lines.

data.title: playtest 20131022 - rank bug
data.body:
the rank-symbols seem to be "behind" infantry units ... 

http://imgur.com/hlfm7lY

data.title: Added an SVG desktop icon for Linux
data.body: all the cool projects ship one.

data.title: OpenAL freezes during first game start - OSX 10.9 (Mavericks)
data.body:
After upgrading to Mavericks and avoiding #3992 I found the game to reproducably hang when trying to initialize the sound engine.

Replacing the contents of ~/Library/Application Support/OpenRA/settings.yaml with

```
Sound:
    Engine: Null
```

(change the 4 spaces to a tab) allowed OpenRA to start.

The default audio device can be reselected in the settings menu to re-enable sound, and prevents the problem from recurring on future launches.

This is a strange one in that it was completely reproducible until I found the above work around. Now I can't reproduce it at all. This seems to be an OS level bug, maybe a stale cache that needed updating.

data.title: OpenRA crashes on open - OSX 10.9 (Mavericks)
data.body:
First time stumbling upon OpenRA / attempting to run it, so not sure if I'm missing something obvious here.

**Repro Steps:**
- Download / install latest stable Mono 3.2.3
- Download / unpack latest stable OpenRA - Mac 20130915
- Open OpenRA, app icon shows in the Dock for an instant then immediately removes itself

**exception.log output:**

```
Exception of type `System.DllNotFoundException`: /Library/Frameworks/SDL.framework/SDL
TypeName=``

  at OpenRA.Renderer.Glsl.DeviceFactory.Create (Size size, WindowMode windowMode) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.CreateDevice (System.Reflection.Assembly rendererDll, Int32 width, Int32 height, WindowMode window$
  at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.Initialize (WindowMode windowMode) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Game.Initialize (OpenRA.Arguments args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at OpenRA.Program.FatalError (System.Exception e) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

```

data.title: New settings menu.
data.body: This overhauls and merges the settings menu for all mods.

data.title: Improve cash ticks.
data.body: This replaces the Normal/Extreme/Disabled options with a checkbox, and tweaks the cash tick rate to more closely match the original games. It also enables cash ticks for C&C.

data.title: Replays Viewer: add two buttons to delete the selected replay file and all replays
data.body:
It could be useful to add two buttons on the Replays Viewer UI: 
- a button to delete the selected replay file 
- ~~a button to delete all replays~~

data.title: Keys Settings: hotkeys are not saved
data.body: I notice that after modifying some hotkeys, they are not saved after clicking CLOSE.

data.title: Keys Settings: it's possible to affect the same hotkey to several commands
data.body:
It seems to be possible to affect the same hotkey to several commands. :-/

data.title: Keys settings: add a "Reset hotkeys" button
data.body: A small feature request: Could it be possible to add a "Reset hotkeys" button ?

data.title: Remove desync from WPos.LerpQuadratic.
data.body: Fixes #3966.

data.title: Polish chat input.
data.body:
This fixes the UI and code quality issues that I had with the "new" chat input and adds it to C&C.
It also knocks another TODO off the list of prerequisites for both #3315 and #2243.

This removes the "toggle team chat" preference and implements the behavior agreed on in IRC: team chat is selected by default, and the player can switch between modes using or by the button.

data.title: Keys Settings: QWERTY instead of AZERTY
data.body:
I use an AZERTY keyboard and this new Hotkey management works like if I have a QWERTY keyboard.
e.g. --> If I press A, it shows Q in this Keys settings page..

Note that there is no problem if I type something in the ingame IRC chatroom (azerty is correctly supported there).

data.title: Asset Browser: OpenRA crashes if you click on LOAD button with an empty textfield
data.body: In the Asset Browser, if you click on the LOAD button while the textfield for the filename is empty, that makes OpenRA crash.

data.title: Changing hotkeys via the ingame settings menu breaks the keyboard focus
data.body: Discovered in #3969, but actually introduced earlier.
